name: JordanCon 2020
_comment: Remember: This file cannot contain images as require(image) cannot have dynamically generated strings.

header_photos.description: Standing ovation for the 10-year service volunteers, which included Guest of Honor Jason Denzel and Vice Chair James Liang.
Con Chair and Vice Chair Jennifer and James Liang receive a special JordanCon 10 gift: handmade sculptures of the Choedan Kal.
Cooper Blackwood joined the ranks of the JordanCon Blademasters after defeating all opponents in the Blademasters Tournament.
Congratulations to Seanchan Hold'em winner Meagan Upole!

content.aboutText: JordanCon is a fantasy literature convention founded in honor of the late author, Robert Jordan. JordanCon features eight tracks of simultaneous programming, a Dealers' Hall, gaming, an Art Show featuring original art by a variety of artists, and charity events benefiting the Mayo Clinic and other charities.
content.appText:
Con-Nexus is a lightweight, open-source convention app framework created by Ben Gundersen, and currently built with React Native. You can find more information on GitHub, or email me: ben@bengundersen.com.

Made with ♥ in New York City

more_content.label: About
content_sections: JordanCon is a fantasy literature convention founded in honor of the late author, Robert Jordan. JordanCon features eight tracks of simultaneous programming, a Dealers' Hall, gaming, an Art Show featuring original art by a variety of artists, and charity events benefiting the Mayo Clinic and other charities.

Con-Nexus is a lightweight, open-source convention app framework created by Ben Gundersen, built using React Native and Expo. You can find more information on GitHub, or email me: ben@bengundersen.com.

Made with ♥ in New York City

more_content.label: Frequently Asked Questions
content_sections: We accept cash, check, and debit/credit (Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, Discover and JCB). This applies to Registration, Art Show, and Silent Auction payments.
Payment types for Vendors are at the discretion of the Vendor.

All bladed weapons must be peace-bound during the convention. Weapons may be brandished briefly for photographers, but must be immediately sheathed afterwards. Projectile weapons must be non-functioning. This includes water guns, silly-string, and ping-pong pistols.

events.title: Kilts & Crowns Photo
events.description: It's Tiara Time! It's Kilt Klatch! Don your tiaras and your kilts, folks and join us for our annual photo. We will meet up in the Downstairs Lobby right after Opening Ceremonies and take the photo at 2:30.
